info.name: Pretectal area
info.description: The pretectal area is located between the superior colliculi of the tectum and the caudal thalamus. It is important since it receives afferents from both the retina and the visual association cortex; it sents output bilaterally to the Edinger-Westphal nuclei. Thus, it is an important component of both the pupillary light reflex and the accommodation or near reflex.
